fast3d.simple.controls

Class RotationControl

  • java.lang.Object
    • fast3d.control.Control
      • fast3d.control.SimpleControl
        • fast3d.simple.controls.RotationControl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ComponentListener, java.awt.event.ContainerListener, java.awt.event.FocusListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.event.MouseWheelListener, java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class RotationControl
extends SimpleControl
    SimpleTopDownRotationUserControl
    works like fast3d.simple.control.autoControl.SimpleTopDownRotationAutoControl but with user input and no auto-rotation
    rotSpeed and zoomSpeed may be adjusted by using the permitted fields
    Author:
    Tim Trense
    See Also:
    RotationAutoControl

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      boolean allowNegativeRotX
      whether to allow the user looking down until -maxRotX
      means rotation over the x-z-plate
      default false
      boolean allowPositiveRotX
      whether to allow the user looking up until maxRotX
      means rotation under the x-z-plate
      default false
      double auto_rotPerSecond
      the automated rotation speed around the y-axis in radiant per second
      default is 0 meaning auto-rotation disabled
      double distanceToZero
      the cameras distance from Vector3d.zero()
      default is 10
      boolean invertRX
      whether to invert the rotation direction around the x-axis
      boolean invertRY
      whether to invert the rotation direction around the y-axis
      double invFriction
      1d / friction where friction is [1d;+infinity[
      coefficient to determine how extreme the slow-down after dragging is if slide == true
      default 0d
      values within [0.85d;0.95d] will do good
      double maxRotX
      the absolute rotation in radiant to rotate up/down to not loose orientation
      double rotSpeed
      how fast the camera rotates on mouseDrag
      default is 0.001d
      double rx
      angle determining whether to look up or down to the Vector3d.zero()
      default is 0.0
      double ry
      the current rotation angle in radiant
      Vector3d translation
      determines around which location in space the camera should orbit
      double zoomSpeed
      how fast the camera zooms on mouseWheelMove
      default is 0.1d

        default 0d
        values within [0.85d;0.95d] will do good
